hard.question: Which algorithm is specifically designed for handling imbalanced datasets by generating synthetic samples of the minority class?
options: K-nearest neighbors (KNN)
Random Forest
SMOTE (Synthetic Minority Over-sampling Technique)
Principal Component Analysis (PCA)

hard.question: What is the primary advantage of using recurrent neural networks (RNNs) over traditional feedforward neural networks?
options: Ability to handle sequential data
Faster training time
Better performance on small datasets
Simplicity of architecture

hard.question: What is the purpose of LDA (Linear Discriminant Analysis) in dimensionality reduction?
options: To maximize the variance between classes
To maximize the variance within classes
To minimize the variance between classes
To minimize the variance within classes
hard.answer: To maximize the variance between classes

hard.question: What is the term used to describe the process of transforming text data into a numerical format suitable for machine learning algorithms?
options: Tokenization
Embedding
Feature extraction
Normalization

hard.question: In unsupervised learning, which algorithm is commonly used for outlier detection based on density estimation?
options: K-means clustering
DBSCAN (Density-Based Spatial Clustering of Applications with Noise)
PCA (Principal Component Analysis)
Apriori algorithm
hard.answer: DBSCAN (Density-Based Spatial Clustering of Applications with Noise)

hard.question: What is the main purpose of the Expectation-Maximization (EM) algorithm in unsupervised learning?
options: To maximize the likelihood function
To minimize the cost function
To find the optimal decision boundary
To estimate parameters of a probabilistic model
hard.answer: To estimate parameters of a probabilistic model

hard.question: What is the term used to describe the process of converting categorical variables into a numerical format in machine learning?
options: One-hot encoding
Label encoding
Ordinal encoding
Binary encoding

hard.question: Which evaluation metric is commonly used for assessing the performance of multi-class classification models?
options: Accuracy
Precision
F1-score
Mean Squared Error (MSE)

hard.question: What is the primary advantage of using ensemble learning techniques such as AdaBoost?
options: Robustness to overfitting
Ability to handle missing data
Interpretability of results
Simplicity of implementation

hard.question: What does the term 'curse of dimensionality' refer to in machine learning?
options: The computational cost increases exponentially with the number of features
The model's performance deteriorates as the number of features increases
The difficulty of visualizing high-dimensional data
The imbalance between the number of samples and features in the dataset
hard.answer: The computational cost increases exponentially with the number of features

medium_hard.question: Which algorithm is commonly used for anomaly detection in time-series data?
options: Linear Regression
K-means Clustering
Isolation Forest
Decision Trees

medium_hard.question: In natural language processing, what is the purpose of stemming?
options: Identifying the root word of a given word
Assigning a sentiment score to text data
Tokenizing sentences into words
Extracting named entities from text data
medium_hard.answer: Identifying the root word of a given word

medium_hard.question: What is the primary difference between L1 and L2 regularization?
options: L1 regularization adds the absolute values of the coefficients to the loss function, while L2 regularization adds the squared values.
L1 regularization penalizes large coefficients more heavily than L2 regularization.
L2 regularization encourages sparsity in the coefficient values, while L1 regularization does not.
L2 regularization is only applicable to linear models, while L1 regularization can be used with any model.
medium_hard.answer: L1 regularization adds the absolute values of the coefficients to the loss function, while L2 regularization adds the squared values.

medium_hard.question: What is the purpose of the A/B test in data science?
options: To evaluate the performance of machine learning models
To compare the effectiveness of different marketing strategies
To preprocess the data before model training
To visualize the distribution of data
medium_hard.answer: To compare the effectiveness of different marketing strategies

medium_hard.question: Which evaluation metric is commonly used for assessing the performance of regression models?
options: Precision
Recall
Mean Absolute Error (MAE)
F1-score

medium_hard.question: What is the purpose of dropout regularization in neural networks?
options: To reduce the computational cost of training the model
To prevent overfitting by randomly dropping units from the neural network during training
To speed up the convergence of the optimization algorithm
To increase the model's capacity to capture complex patterns in the data
medium_hard.answer: To prevent overfitting by randomly dropping units from the neural network during training

medium_hard.question: Which algorithm is commonly used for collaborative filtering in recommendation systems?
options: K-means Clustering
Random Forest
Singular Value Decomposition (SVD)
Gradient Boosting Machines (GBM)

medium_hard.question: What is the purpose of the EM (Expectation-Maximization) algorithm in clustering?
options: To maximize the likelihood function of the data given the model parameters
To minimize the within-cluster sum of squares
To initialize the centroids for K-means clustering
To estimate the parameters of a mixture model from incomplete data
medium_hard.answer: To estimate the parameters of a mixture model from incomplete data

medium_hard.question: Which technique is commonly used for feature engineering in time-series data?
options: Principal Component Analysis (PCA)
Lag features
One-hot encoding
Bag-of-Words representation

medium_hard.question: What is the purpose of cross-entropy loss in classification problems?
options: To measure the difference between probability distributions
To minimize the mean squared error between predicted and actual values
To regularize the weights of the neural network
To reduce the variance of the model
medium_hard.answer: To measure the difference between probability distributions
